India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates - The Times of India
summary:
India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Times of India

The Indian government recently released estimates indicating that the GDP growth rate for the fiscal year 2025 is expected to slow to 6.4%, a significant drop from 8.2% in the previous year. This slowdown raises concerns about economic stability and growth prospects in the country.

  • The GDP growth rate is projected to fall to 6.4% for FY25.
  • This is a decrease from the 8.2% growth rate recorded in FY24.
  • Experts suggest various factors, including inflation and global economic conditions, are impacting growth.
  • The government is expected to implement measures to stimulate the economy.
"The reduction in GDP growth highlights the challenges facing the Indian economy moving forward." - Economic Analyst

The shift to a lower growth forecast underscores the imperative for reforms to bolster economic performance in the coming years.
newTitle: India's GDP Growth Slows to 6.4% for FY25: Government Estimates

summary:
Top Tech Trends 2025: A Comprehensive Overview

“In 2025, we see AI and Gen AI having a major impact on companies’ priorities and also on many adjacent technology domains.” - Pascal Brier

This comprehensive analysis provides insights for business leaders on navigating the complexity of future technology trends.

title: Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation - Microsoft
summary:
Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Microsoft Stories India

Microsoft has announced a significant investment aimed at enhancing AI and cloud capabilities in India, emphasizing the importance of skilling and infrastructure development.

  • Microsoft plans to invest $3 billion in India for cloud and AI infrastructure over two years.
  • The goal is to train 10 million individuals in AI skills by 2030.
  • Establishment of new datacenters to support growing AI needs in India.
“India is rapidly becoming a leader in AI innovation, unlocking new opportunities across the country.” - Satya Nadella

This investment sets the stage for India to become an AI-first nation while fostering innovation and entrepreneurship across various sectors.
newTitle: Microsoft's $3 Billion Investment to Boost AI and Cloud Infrastructure in India

title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 12.10x so far, retail portion subscribed 44.38x. Check GMP | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 13.45x so far, retail portion subscribed 48.32x. Check GMP

Date: 07 Jan, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Quadrant Future Tek IPO, valued at ₹290 crore, has opened for public subscription with strong initial interest. The retail portion has seen significant booking, with multiple stages of interest reported throughout the day.

  • The IPO consists solely of a new issue worth up to ₹290 crore.
  • Price band set between ₹275-290 per share, open for subscription from January 7 to January 9.
  • Over ₹130 crore secured from anchor investors prior to the public subscription.
  • Retail investors subscribed 48.32 times, with total issue booked 13.45 times as of the latest updates.
  • Funds from the IPO will be used for long-term working capital needs and capital expenditures.
“The company's IPO has garnered substantial interest from retail and institutional investors, indicating strong market confidence.”

This IPO is a promising opportunity focused on India's railway safety systems and signaling technology, a sector expected to grow significantly over the coming years.
newTitle: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 13.45x so far, retail portion subscribed 48.32x. Check GMP

title: One Mobikwik Systems shares climb over 14% after Q2 results announcement - Mint
summary:
One Mobikwik Systems Shares Surge 14% Following Q2 Earnings Release

Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

MobiKwik shares experienced a significant rise following the announcement of its Q2 earnings, marking a milestone for the company post-IPO.

The share price climbed 14 percent to ₹638 on January 7, 2024, following the earnings announcement for the quarter ending September 2024. This was MobiKwik's first quarterly results release since its market debut in December 2024.

  • MobiKwik's share price is now 129% above its IPO issue price of ₹279.
  • The company reported a net loss of ₹3.5 crore for Q2, down from a profit of ₹5.2 crore in the same period last year.
  • Operational revenue increased by 43% year-on-year, reaching ₹291 crore.
  • Investments are focused on driving growth despite the incurred losses.
  • MobiKwik serves 161 million registered users and has a merchant network of 4.3 million.
MobiKwik commands a 23.11% market share in India’s PPI wallet segment as of May 2024.

In conclusion, despite current losses, MobiKwik continues to show strong growth potential and adapt its strategies to capture the digital payment market in India.
newTitle: One Mobikwik Systems Shares Surge 14% Following Q2 Earnings Release

title: Space race: Toyota invests $44 million in rocket startup amid Japan govt push for private sector | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Toyota Invests $44 Million in Rocket Startup Amid Japan's Private Sector Push

Publication Date: January 7, 2024   Source: Live Mint

The global space race is accelerating as Toyota Motor Corporation invests in the Japanese startup Interstellar Technologies, aiming to enhance Japan's space industry.

  • Toyota invests $44 million in Interstellar Technologies to mass produce lightweight rockets.
  • The investment is part of a broader initiative to innovate in transportation, not limited to automotive.
  • The Japanese government encourages private sector involvement in expanding the country's space capabilities.
  • Toyota previously collaborated with JAXA to build a lunar rover for NASA's Artemis program.
  • Japan aims for 30 space launches per year by 2030, requiring a significant transformation of the domestic space industry.
“The future of mobility shouldn’t be limited to just cars.” - Akio Toyoda, Toyota Chairman

This investment represents a strategic move for Toyota and Japan to remain competitive in the evolving space sector, highlighting the importance of public-private partnerships.
newTitle: Toyota Invests $44 Million in Rocket Startup Amid Japan's Private Sector Push

Stocks to buy for short term: Mehta Equities' Riyank Arora suggests these 3 shares to buy amid HMPV virus cases in India | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Stocks to buy for short term: Mehta Equities’ Riyank Arora suggests these 3 shares to buy amid HMPV virus cases in India

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market showed signs of recovery on Tuesday despite earlier setbacks, with analysts suggesting three key stocks for short-term investment amidst ongoing concerns about the human metapneumovirus (HMPV) outbreak.

Key Points

  • The Nifty 50 rose by 0.36% to 23,700.80 points.
  • BSE Sensex climbed 0.19% to 78,109.41.
  • Analysts expect quarterly earnings to influence stock market direction.
  • Market recovery is contingent on a favorable budget and interest rate reductions.
  • Riyank Arora recommends buying:
    • Enviro Infra Engineers Ltd
    • Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd (ONGC)
    • Tata Motors Ltd

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“A strict stop loss at ₹289 for Enviro Infra Engineers is recommended to manage risks effectively.”
“A sustained hold above ₹49,500 could lead to a recovery toward ₹51,000 and beyond.”

Conclusion

The current market sees volatility spurred by health concerns, but with strategic stock selections and careful monitoring, investors can find opportunities even in a challenging environment.
newTitle: Stocks to Buy for Short Term: 3 Picks Amid HMPV Virus Cases

title: Suzlon share price jumps after the green energy company’s reply on stock movement | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Suzlon Share Price Jumps Following Clarification on Stock Movement

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Mint

Suzlon share price increased by over 3% after a period of decline, following the company's response regarding its stock price volatility.

  • Suzlon shares saw a rebound of 3.65%, reaching ₹61.03 on the BSE.
  • Prior to the increase, shares closed at a 5% lower circuit the day before.
  • The stock had fallen over 10% in the previous three trading sessions.
  • Suzlon clarified that no specific event caused the stock's fluctuations, attributing it to a Material Price Movement (MPM).
  • Despite a 14% decline in three months, shares have risen 50% in the past year and delivered 495% returns over two years.
“This is to inform that a Material Price Movement (“MPM”) has been noticed in the scrip of Suzlon Energy Limited... however we could not ascertain any event or information in the mainstream media which could have triggered this MPM,” - Suzlon Energy

In conclusion, while Suzlon's recent performance shows volatility, the long-term returns remain significant for investors.
newTitle: Suzlon Share Price Jumps Following Clarification on Stock Movement

Gold bulls seem non-committed amid Fed's hawkish signal - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Bulls Show Uncertainty Amid Fed's Hawkish Signals

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: FXStreet

The gold price is showing a mild positive bias but struggles to gain momentum due to geopolitical risks and the Federal Reserve's hawkish stance.

  • Gold attracts haven flows amid concerns about US trade policies.
  • The Fed’s hawkish stance caps potential gains for gold amidst rising bond yields.
  • Traders are waiting for FOMC minutes and Nonfarm Payrolls reports.
“Despite significant progress in lowering price pressures, inflation remains uncomfortably above the 2% target.” - San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly

The current market environment reflects caution among traders as they assess both geopolitical tensions and forthcoming economic reports, indicating potential volatility in gold prices.
newTitle: Gold Bulls Show Uncertainty Amid Fed's Hawkish Signals

Automobile retail sales decline 12% in December; jump 9% in CY2024: FADA - Moneycontrol
summary:
Automobile retail sales decline 12% in December; jump 9% in CY2024: FADA

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Automobile retail sales faced a decline in December but reported overall growth for the year 2024. The Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) highlights the resilience of the auto retail industry amid various challenges.

  • December retail sales declined by 12%.
  • Overall vehicle registrations totaled 2,61,07,679 units in 2024, marking a 9% growth compared to 2023.
  • Significant demand for two-wheelers and passenger vehicles supported growth despite challenging conditions.
  • President C S Vigneshwar cited multiple headwinds impacting the sector, including weather conditions and elections.
"Despite multiple headwinds in CY24, including heatwaves, elections at both central and state levels and uneven monsoon, the auto retail industry remained resilient." - C S Vigneshwar, FADA President

The automobile retail sector showed both decline and growth trends, pointing to a fluctuating market influenced by external factors in 2024.
newTitle: Automobile Retail Sales Show Significant Variations in December and 2024

title: NIFTY50 trades above 23,700, SENSEX jumps 250 points; ONGC, Tata Consumer and Tata Motors among top gainers - Upstox
summary:
Indian Equity Markets Rise: NIFTY50 surpasses 23,700 and SENSEX up by 250 points

Publication Date: January 7, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Indian equity benchmarks are witnessing gains in the mid-market session, primarily driven by investments in major blue-chip stocks.

  • The SENSEX is trading at 78,293.12, up by 328.13 points or 0.42%.
  • The NIFTY50 has reached 23,740.45, increasing by 124.40 points or 0.53%.
  • Top gainers in the NIFTY50 include ONGC, Titan Company, and Reliance Industries.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors sold equities worth ₹2,575.06 crore.
  • Most Asian markets are trading positively, responding to Wall Street's gains.
"The gains in the market are driven by increased buying in blue-chip stocks despite selling pressure from foreign investors."

The rally in the stock market signals investor optimism, although caution is warranted due to the recent selling by FIIs.

title: Equinox India Developments shares in 20% upper circuit after NCLAT approves merger with Embassy - CNBCTV18
summary:
Equinox India Shares Surge 20% After NCLAT Approves Merger with Embassy Group

Date: Jan 7, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

Equinox India Developments Ltd. shares are locked in a 20% upper circuit after the NCLAT approved the merger with Embassy Group.

  • The deal was first announced in August 2020.
  • Approval by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) was granted in February 2021.
  • The NCLT Bengaluru bench had previously approved the merger.
  • Concerns from the income tax department stalled the merger in March 2023.
  • The NCLAT has allowed the merger, setting aside previous concerns.
  • The merger will result in the Embassy Group holding a majority stake in the new entity.
  • Equinox India was formerly known as Indiabulls Real Estate.
  • Shares are currently priced at 143.58.
The NCLAT is trying to put to an end, an issue that has stretched over four years.

This merger marks a significant step for Equinox India Developments as it navigates through regulatory challenges.
newTitle: Equinox India Shares Surge 20% After NCLAT Approves Merger with Embassy Group

One Mobikwik Systems shares climb around 8% ahead of Q2 results announcement | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
One Mobikwik Systems shares climb around 8% ahead of Q2 results announcement

Date: January 7, 2024

Source: Live Mint

One Mobikwik Systems shares increased by 8% to ₹601.35 ahead of the Q2 earnings announcement for the September quarter of 2024, marking the first such announcement since its IPO.

  1. The stock debuted on December 18, 2024, at a 58.51% premium, currently trading 115% above its IPO price.
  2. MobiKwik reported a 62.2% revenue increase to ₹875 crore in FY24.
  3. The company achieved profitability with a PBT of ₹14 crore, contrasting with a loss of ₹81 crore in FY23.
  4. Notable EBITDA improvement with a margin of 2.5% in FY24, compared to -14.4% in FY23.
  5. Its market share in India's PPI wallet segment is 23.11% by gross transaction value as of May 2024.
"The capital raised through the IPO is being allocated to scale financial and payment services, bolster AI and machine learning capabilities."

MobiKwik's growth is propelled by a strong digital payment ecosystem, enhancing its role as a leader in digital financial services.
newTitle: One Mobikwik Systems shares climb around 8% ahead of Q2 results announcement

Paras Defence shares soar 10%, hit upper circuit on receiving license to manufacture MK-46 and MK-48 machine guns | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Paras Defence Shares Surge 10% After License for Machine Gun Manufacturing

Date: January 7, 2023

Source: Mint

Shares of Paras Defence and Space Technologies surged 10% following the company's announcement that it received a license to manufacture MK-46 and MK-48 Light Machine Guns.

  • The license, granted under the Arms Act, allows for the production of up to 6,000 units annually.
  • Shares rose to ₹1,066.50, hitting the upper circuit.
  • The stock is currently down 49% from its 52-week high but has increased 75% from its low.
  • The company also announced a new optical systems testing facility and received a sizeable order from the Ministry of Defence.
“The license is valid for a lifetime and is likely to significantly influence the company's manufacturing capabilities.”

Despite recent fluctuations, Paras Defence has displayed resilience, boosting investor confidence.
newTitle: Paras Defence Shares Surge 10% After License for Machine Gun Manufacturing

title: Paras Defence shares jump 10% on getting license to manufacture Light Machine Guns - CNBCTV18
summary:
Paras Defence Shares Jump 10% on Getting License to Manufacture Light Machine Guns

Publication Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Paras Defence and Space Technologies Ltd. has received a license to manufacture Light Machine Guns, resulting in a significant surge in its share price by 10%.

  • The license, granted under the Arms Act of 1959, is valid for a lifetime.
  • Authorized production includes the MK-46 and MK-48 belt-fed LMGs, with an annual capacity of 6,000 guns each.
  • The current order book exceeds ₹850 crore, contributing positively to the Defense Engineering business.
  • Despite recent gains, shares are 40% down from their previous peak.
  • Paras Defence’s IPO was among the most subscribed in India, with over ₹38,000 crore in bids.
“We continue to maintain a strong order book,” said Amit Mahajan of Paras Defence.

Overall, the license approval is seen as a positive development for Paras Defence, affirming its positioning within the defense manufacturing sector.
newTitle: Paras Defence Shares Surge 10% After License Approval for Light Machine Guns
